Top-3 Similar Questions: so_9117507: Linux/Unix command to determine if process is running?
Top-3 Scripts:
so_9117507: #!/bin/bash
ps cax | grep httpd > /dev/null
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "Process is running."
else
  echo "Process is not running."
fi

ps cax | grep httpd | grep -o '^[ ]*[0-9]*'

#!/bin/bash
ps cax | grep httpd
if [ $? -eq 0 ]; then
  echo "Process is running."
else
  echo "Process is not running."
fi

Explanations about Options.-c:
Starts top with the last remembered `c' state reversed. Thus, if top was displaying
 command lines, now that field will show program names, and vice versa. See the `c'
 interactive command for additional information.
